statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 0 \\ -1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 4 \\ 1 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -4 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ -16 \\ 2 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 0 \\ -1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 4 \\ 1 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -4 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ -16 \\ 2 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4.
